edu.gvsu.dlunit

Class BitSetUtilities.WidthTooSmallException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • java.lang.RuntimeException
          • java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
            • edu.gvsu.dlunit.BitSetUtilities.InvalidWidthException
              • edu.gvsu.dlunit.BitSetUtilities.WidthTooSmallException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Enclosing class:
    BitSetUtilities

    public static class BitSetUtilities.WidthTooSmallException
extends BitSetUtilities.InvalidWidthException
    Exception thrown when user requests that a large value be represented using too few bits (e.g., that 1024 be represented using 5 bits). This exception is intended to be used when the value is fixed and user is specifying the number of bits.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • WidthTooSmallException

        public WidthTooSmallException(int desired_width,
                              int required_width,
                              java.lang.String extra)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        desired_width - the width the user wants the BitSet to be (or believes the BitSet is).
        required_width - the actual width of the code BitSet. (For signed data, this is the location of the sign bit. For Unsigned data, this is typically based on the location of the most significant 1.)
        extra - A String containing more information about the cause of the error.
